pull_request.title: allow execution of `on_unknown_torrent` method in the absence of active torrents

repo.name: libtorrent

repo.name: libtorrent
repo.description: an efficient feature complete C++ bittorrent implementation

issue.title: Unhandled exception thrown by Boost.Asio
issue.body: There are many crash reports in qBittorrent bug tracker that point to unhandled exception thrown in [boost::asio::detail::socket_select_interrupter::open_descriptors](https://github.com/qbittorrent/qBittorrent/search?q=socket_select_interrupter&type=issues). IIRC, exception is often thrown once some VPN service is enabled during qBittorrent run.

forkee.name: libtorrent
forkee.description: an efficient feature complete C++ bittorrent implementation

issue.title: 100% of CPU core is used when torrent with mix of I2P and non-I2P trackers is added
issue.body:
This problem can be reproduced with I2P mode **disabled**.
Just run `client_test` with default parameters, like this: `client_test --alert_mask=all` and add such magnet link:
`magnet:?xt=urn:btih:70260ca39b2867a59f46d81db85eecb256b9365c&dn=I2P%20Update%202.1.0&tr=http%3A%2F%2Ftracker2.postman.i2p%2Fannounce.php&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.opentrackr.org%3A1337%2Fannounce`
Then observe CPU usage.

I suspect hang may be related to function `libtorrent::torrent::update_tracker_timer`.

_libtorrent version (or branch):_ 5ce4c516479085eda9327d35891b7732d6d5037b
_platform/architecture:_ Windows x64
_compiler and compiler version:_ clang version 15.0.7

comment.body:
confirm 1 core 100% 2nd 50%, not going past 'no metadata'
 209 win64 MSVS 17.7.3

issue.title: Python 3.11 wheels?
issue.body: I am lookin at pypi, it seems the wheels are built up to python3.10, any plan to push 3.11 builds?

issue.title: 100% of CPU core is used when torrent with mix of I2P and non-I2P trackers is added
issue.body:
This problem can be reproduced with I2P mode **disabled**.
Just run `client_test` with default parameters, like this: `client_test --alert_mask=all` and add such magnet link:
`magnet:?xt=urn:btih:70260ca39b2867a59f46d81db85eecb256b9365c&dn=I2P%20Update%202.1.0&tr=http%3A%2F%2Ftracker2.postman.i2p%2Fannounce.php&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.opentrackr.org%3A1337%2Fannounce`
Then observe CPU usage.

I suspect hang may be realted to function `libtorrent::torrent::update_tracker_timer`.

_libtorrent version (or branch):_ 5ce4c516479085eda9327d35891b7732d6d5037b
_platform/architecture:_ Windows x64
_compiler and compiler version:_ clang version 15.0.7

forkee.name: libtorrent

issue.title: qBit v4.4.3.1 + libtorrent 2.0.x freezes regularly (Arch Linux)
issue.body:
qbittorrent: 4.4.3.1 x64
OS: Arch Linux
Qt: 6.3.0 and 5.15.4
libtorrent-rasterbar: 2.0.6

I reported it first in the [qBittorrent bugtracker](https://github.com/qbittorrent/qBittorrent/issues/17216) but the problem only happens with version 2.x of libtorrent, if I use version 1.x it works without problems. So I'm not sure where the problem really lies: in the program or in the library.

I have the computer always on with qBittorrent running. Every now and then qBittorrent freezes.
I have to restart the computer because I can't even kill the process.
